page.title: 13BERROW BEACH
page.content: BERROW BEACH LIES NORTH AND SOUTH ON THE EAST COAST OF THE BRISTOL CHANNEL. THE BEACH IS FLAT AND SANDY BACKED BY SAND DUNES AND FRONTED BY MUD FLATS. ACCESS IS BY A ROAD OFF THE COAST ROAD. THE NORTHERN 2KM AND THE SOUTHERN 1KM ARE OPEN TO VEHICLES.BETWEEN THESE TWO AREAS THERE IS A VEHICLE FREE AREA. IN COMMON WITH ALL BRISTOL CHANNEL RESORTS,THERE IS A LARGE TIDAL RANGE. WHEN THE TIDE IS IN,THERE IS A GOOD SAFE SEA BATHING.AT LOW TIDE,THE MUD FLATS CAN BE DANGEROUS. THE SAND DUNES HAVE BEEN ERODED BY VISITORS AND WORK HAS BEEN DONE TO PREVENT CARS BEING DRIVEN INTO THE DUNES.THE DUNES HAVE WOODEN FENCING TO ENCOURAGE THE BUILD UP OF THE SAND,THIS IS PROVING TO BE A SUCCESS.
